solution_line_template: Every second month Nina does twice the regular distance, which means {regular_distance} * {twice_factor} = <<{regular_distance}*{twice_factor}={increased_distance}>>{increased_distance} kilometers.
Two years is {years_to_months} months, so half of this time is {years_to_months} * {half_factor} = <<{years_to_months}*{half_factor}={months_half_period}>>{months_half_period} months.
So in {months_half_period} months Nina does {regular_distance} * {months_half_period} = <<{regular_distance}*{months_half_period}={distance_regular_months}>>{distance_regular_months} kilometers.

And in the other {months_half_period} months, she does {increased_distance} * {months_half_period} = <<{increased_distance}*{months_half_period}={distance_increased_months}>>{distance_increased_months} kilometers.

So in two years, Nina would be able to make {distance_regular_months} + {distance_increased_months} = <<{distance_regular_months}+{distance_increased_months}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} kilometers.
